meanings.definition: To make a game less enjoyable or interesting.
meanings.sent1: She always degames the board game by changing the rules halfway through.
meanings.sent2: I hope you don't degames our fun by being too competitive.
meanings.sent3: He tried to degames the video game by playing blindfolded, but it just made it more challenging.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments from the player degames the overall experience for everyone.
meanings.sent5: The glitch in the system degames the entire gaming experience, frustrating many players.

meanings.definition: The act of making a game less enjoyable or interesting.
meanings.sent1: His constant degames of the game led to fewer people wanting to play with him.
meanings.sent2: The degames of the tournament was evident in the decreasing number of participants.
meanings.sent3: The group's degames of the game turned it into a chaotic mess, but they had fun.
meanings.sent4: The company's neglect of updates is a degames to the once-popular game.
meanings.sent5: The player's intentional degames of the game caused frustration among the other players.
